page.title: 06Geology and Soils/Guyzance.
page.content: The solid geology of the area is not conspicuous,the limestone and millstone grit largely being concealed by boulder clay drift.Some limestone was quarried and burnt and the lime used to improve farmland.Extensive coal measures underlie adjacent areas but mining has not been a feature of this area although small scale mining occurred in the past.Tha Acklington Dyke(whin) outcrops alongside the Coquet at Brainshaugh. The retreating ice sheet left it's mark in the area by depositing a thick layer of boulder clay.These clays vary within the area.North of the Coquet the soil consists of high quality loam but south of the river the soils are heavy clay which are improved with slag.At Brotherwick and Warkworth Moor sands and gravel occur.Managed care- fully,these soils result in good farms
